document.heading: Amendments to an Act to Provide for Voluntary Apprenticeship in the District of Columbia Act of 1978

history.narrative: Law 2-156, the “Amendments to an Act to Provide for Voluntary Apprenticeship in the District of Columbia Act of 1978,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-325, which was referred to the Committee on Employment and Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 28, 1978 and December 12, 1978, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 29, 1978, it was assigned Act No. 2-325 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
